1:
Indeed, my heart trembles at this;\q it is moved out of its place.
\q
2:
Hear, oh, hear the noise of his voice,\q the sound that goes out from his mouth.
\q
3:
He sends it out under the whole sky,\q and he sends out his lightning to the edges of the earth.


\q
5:
God thunders marvelously with his voice;\q he does great things that we cannot comprehend.
\q
6:
For he says to the snow, 'Fall on the earth';\q likewise to the rain shower,
\q 'Become a great shower of rain.'


\q
7:
He stops the hand of every man from working,\q so that all people whom he has made may see his deeds.
\q
8:
Then the beasts go into hiding\q and stay in their dens.
\q
9:
The storm comes from its chamber in the south\q and the cold from the scattering winds in the north.


\q
10:
By the breath of God ice is given;\q the expanse of the waters is frozen like metal.
\q
11:
Indeed, he weighs down the thick cloud with moisture;\q he scatters his lightning through the clouds.


\q
12:
He swirls the clouds around by his guidance,\q so that they may do whatever he commands them
\q above the surface of the whole world.
\q
13:
He makes all of this happen; sometimes it happens for correction, sometimes for his land,\q and sometimes as acts of covenant faithfulness.
\m


\q
14:
Listen to this, Job;\q stop and think about God's marvelous deeds.
\q
15:
Do you know how God establishes the clouds\q and makes the lightning bolts to flash in them?


\q
16:
Do you understand the floating of the clouds,\q the marvelous deeds of God, who is perfect in knowledge?
\q
17:
Do you understand how your garments become hot\q when the land is still because the wind comes from the south?


\q
18:
Can you spread out the sky as he can—\q the sky, which is as strong as a mirror of cast metal?
\q
19:
Teach us what we should say to him,\q for we cannot lay out our arguments in order because of the darkness of our minds.
\q
20:
Should he be told that I wish to speak with him?\q Would a person wish to be swallowed up?
\m


\q
21:
Now, people cannot look at the sun when it is bright in the sky\q after the wind has passed through and has cleared it of its clouds.
\q
22:
Out of the north comes golden splendor—\q over God is fearsome majesty.


\q
24: Therefore, people fear him.\q He does not pay any attention to those who are wise in their own minds."
